section.name: Running the Examples Using the Binary Distribution
section.p: The process for running the distribution of the examples is quite simple. All you need is a working J2EE application server like Tomcat, JBoss, Jetty, Resin, WebSphere, etc. and the war file from the examples distribution. Basically the process is outlined as follows:
In the following sections each step is described in more detail.

subsection.name: Download the Distribution
subsection.p:
In order to run the examples from the distribution (so you don't have to build the examples yourself) you need to
download the latest release
from a mirror close to you. After the download you have to unpack the archive which will give you
a war archive,
a file containing the Apache license
the source files and
a directory containing some basic documentation.

subsection.name: Using an Existing Application Server
subsection.p: Next you need to copy the war archive in your deployment directory of your application server. For example:

tr.th: Default deployment directory relative to installation

subsection.p: If your application server is not listed here, please consult your manual on how to deploy web archives (war files).

subsection.name: Run the Examples
subsection.p:
If you're done copying, all you need to do is start your application server and point your browser to
http://localhost:8080/wicket-examples
(this link will not work when the listening port of your application server is configured to listen to another port than port 8080 ).
